alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 12:48PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henry County through 115 PM CDT... At 1248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Abbeville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Barnes, Edwin, Hardwickburg, Capps, Otho, Hayes, Murphy Station, Graball, Screamer, Lawrenceville, Abbeville Municipal A/P and Willis Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
